content.question: A particle moves along a line so that at time t, where <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" aria-label="0 less than or equal to t less than or equal to pi"> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mi>π</mi></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbiqaaWKgqaaaaa aaaaWdbiaaicdacqGHKjYOcaWG0bGaeyizImQaeqiWdahaaa@3D59@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> , its position is given by <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" aria-label="s of t equals negative 4 times cosine t minus t squared divided by 2 plus 10"> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>cos</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbiqaaWKgqaaaaa aaaaWdbiaadohacaGGOaGaamiDaiaacMcacqGH9aqpcqGHsislcaaI 0aGaci4yaiaac+gacaGGZbGaamiDaiabgkHiTmaalaaapaqaa8qaca WG0bWdamaaCaaaleqabaWdbiaaikdaaaaak8aabaWdbiaaikdaaaGa ey4kaSIaaGymaiaaicdaaaa@469F@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> . What is the velocity ofthe particle when its acceleration is zero?
